meanings.sent1: Her calculous mind quickly solved the math problem.
meanings.sent2: The calculous student always double-checked his work.
meanings.sent3: The calculous accountant never made mistakes in his calculations.
meanings.sent4: His calculous approach to problem-solving impressed his peers.
meanings.sent5: The calculous professor's explanations were always clear and precise.

meanings.definition: Forming or containing calculi (hard concretions in the body).
meanings.sent1: The patient underwent surgery to remove the calculous stones from his kidney.
meanings.sent2: The calculous growth in her gallbladder required medical attention.
meanings.sent3: The calculous deposits in the pipes caused a blockage in the plumbing.
meanings.sent4: The calculous mass in the soil was carefully analyzed by the geologist.
meanings.sent5: The calculous buildup in the aquarium needed to be cleaned regularly.
